1517335328_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
Currently Firefox is just my secondary browser (with Vivaldi as primary), so I'm not deep into Firefox add-ons. In addition to basic security / privacy ones already mentioned (HTTPS Everywhere, uMatrix etc).
+ [**Dark Reader**](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-GB/firefox/addon/darkreader/).
Makes webpages dark. to stop my retinas being burned when browsing at night. Unfortunately it's not perfect. Especially, it doesn't catch a lot of FF's own "internal" pages, like interstitial windows, error pages, add-on manager, so my eyeballs frequently get blasted.
Open source, says it doesn't collect user data.
+ [**Torrentz2 Magnet Links +**](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-GB/firefox/addon/torrentz2-magnet-links/). 
Restores magnet URIs and .torrent links to the Torrentz2 search engine, plus a few other tweaks.
Open source licence and only accesses data on Torrentz2 domains.
